title: Script wanted – Polish language support
content:
Dear all, does anyone know about nice script typeface, alternative to Lavanderia [http://www.losttype.com/lavanderia/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150421052956/http:/www.losttype.com/lavanderia/) that would work in Polish? Good or at least acceptable diacritics required, and readable version of digraphs used in Polish (rz, cz, sz), like those in Liza.

Most of the scripts, I have found, use "z" with the bottom loop and the script version of the "r" (like in Feel Script), which is not always readable in Polish.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150421052956im_/http:/typophile.com/files/lavanderia_one_5782.png)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150421052956im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Liza_3506.png)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150421052956im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Feel_6185.png)
author: ancymonic

comments.content:
How about Promocyja.otf by Gluk?  
It’s script and even has a “double ł” available as an Opentype ligature.  
The “z” is not looped, and the “r” is normal.

Bern
